intro: Grastidium leytense, commonly known as the Leyte grass or Leyte sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender stems and small, triangular leaves are characteristic of the sedge family. Grastidium leytense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline conditions.
